title.narrative: BR Rio Grande do Norte Integrated Water Resources Management

description.narrative: The higher level objective of the project is to promote economic, social, and environmentally sustainable development through the implementation of an integrated water resources management system. Mostly by focusing on institutional strengthening and rehabilitation of key bulk water infrastructure, the proposed project will seek to consolidate this system, which the state has often overlooked in the past in favor of larger infrastructure investments. The specific project development objective is to implement an integrated water resources management system that will support more environmentally sustainable use of water resources while also increasing access of poor families to reliable potable water and decreasing operational and maintenance costs of water allocation and distribution systems.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Assign and maintain until completion of the Project, a council to be responsible for overall guidance with respect to Projectexecution and a PMU for general management.
Enter into institutional arrangements with each of EMATER, EMPARN, IGARN and CAERN, and a cooperation agreement with SEPLAN.
Exercise its rights and comply with its obligations under each of the agreements referred in (b) above.
Maintain a Project monitoring and information system in SEMARH to monitor and evaluate the Project on an on-going basis, inaccordance with the performance indicators in the Operational Manual.
Prepare and furnish to the Bank a monitoring and evaluation report each year, starting twelve months after the Effective Date.
Prepare and furnish to the Bank a plan for the future operation of the Project.

title.narrative: Number of producers who benefited from hidroenvironmental works at Cobra River Basin.

comment.narrative: Incremental indicator. Baseline is zero.
Indirectly, 3,167 inhabitants in 7 municipalities were benefited by the activities.

title.narrative: Improved community water points constructed or rehabilitated under the project

comment.narrative: Incremental indicator. Baseline is zero.
33 systems will benefit 14,599 people or 3,591 families.Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.
29 systems benefited 12,925 people or 2,670 additional families. 4 systems are not operating due to either lack of water resourcesor problems in construction.

title.narrative: River Basin Committees created and strengthened.

comment.narrative: Incremental indicator. Baseline is zero.

title.narrative: Water resources monitoring and information network.

baseline.value: Network weak with few available information

comment.narrative: Indicator slightly revised during Project restructuring in August 2012.
Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.
Network operational - 33 posts purchased and 15 installed. 18 to be installed by SEMARH until November. The network wasrestructured in partnership with the National Water Agency (ANA).

title.narrative: Management Plan of Cruzeta irrigation perimeter prepared with participation of APICRUZ and being implemented.

comment.narrative: Indicator was revised during Project restructuring in August 2012.
Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.

actual.value: Plan under preparation by SEMARH, completion expected by January 2015.

comment.narrative: Plan completion depends on current discussions with DNOCS and ANA about the management of the reservoir.

title.narrative: # of small desalinization units rehabilitated and being used

comment.narrative: Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.
127 desalinization units belonging from SEMARH and other state institutions have been rehabilitated benefiting more than 20,000families.

title.narrative: # of communities with water and sanitation systems adequately sustained

comment.narrative: 33 systems will benefit 14,599 people or 3,591 families.Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.
29 benefiting 12,925 people or 2,670 families.

title.narrative: Dissemination Plan completed and Public Communication Actions implemented

comment.narrative: Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.
Dissemination Plan completed. Several publications prepared used for dissemination of Project activities. The project website isoperational and updated.
Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.
Including 17 installed by ANA. 15 posts purchased by the Project installed. The remaining 18 are being installed by SEMARH untilNovember.

title.narrative: # of technical and financial reports submitted on time

comment.narrative: Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.

actual.value: All technical and financial reports submitted on time.

comment.narrative: Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.

actual.value: Legislation revised and approved by the State Assembly.

comment.narrative: Few progress made in terms of adopting the new legislation.

title.narrative: Diagnosis of the State Water Resources Plan revised.

actual.value: Diagnosis report prepared by the consulting firm was not approved by SEMARH.

comment.narrative: Consulting firm performance was poor. The contract was canceled and no product was approved.

title.narrative: # of families using improved water supply systems

comment.narrative: Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.
Indicator remains the same. End target date revised only.
29 systems implemented by the Project are under operation. 4 systems are not operating due to either lack of water resources orproblems in construction.

title.narrative: Monsenhor Expedito pipeline and distribution systems water losses controlled, macro and micro-measured.

actual.value: System macro and micro-measured. 25,000 micrometers purchased and installed. 132 macrometers purchased, to be completely installedby CAERN by January 2015.

comment.narrative: The activities financed by the Project were part of the Company's strategy for loss control. Other activities were carried out bythe Company in this system and others.

title.narrative: Implementation of SEMARH and IGARN Strategic Planning, in accordance with the approved legislation.

actual.value: SEMARH and IGARN worked on a first draft of the regulation of their newly approved law but these regulation have not been approvedby the Governor yet. In accordance with the approved legislation, a few functions have been transferred from SEMARH to IGARN.
